postsData.content:
Working in SaaS in 2025 might be a mistake...

I've been doing this for 20+ years.

And honestly, I've never seen anything quite like this.

- OpenAI drops agents
- Layoffs across 90% of big tech
- Development teams getting terminated
- AI SDRs outdoing 75%+ of all SDR teams
- Platforms kicking you off when you don't violate TOS

You're more disposable than ever.

It's been on my mind...

and as I've been talking to CROs and VPs of sales in my network,

more and more companies are planning on changes like this.

Which means most of you are SOL.


Here's what I think it'll take to make it in SaaS:


1) Pick up AI/automation tools

2) Focus on key accounts

3) In-person/social x10

Buyers will crave REAL human-to-human selling more than ever.

- Go to conferences
- Get coffee with prospects
- Build relationships across socials


But since I've been doing this for years, I already know many of you will NOT take this advice.

And the cycle will continue, and the battle will wage on.

Or...I'm dead wrong.

For all the innovation in AI, let‚Äôs be real:

ChatGPT‚Äôs UI has been lowkey frustrating.

‚Ü≥ Juggling multiple tools (search, code, vision)

Ô∏è GPT-4.5 (Orion) drops in the next few weeks‚Äôs final ‚Äútraditional‚Äù model.

Ô∏è GPT-5 follows in a few months, merging everything into one unified intelligence.

Ô∏è No more model picking. No more tool toggling. Just one AI that adapts in real-time.

This is the move OpenAI needed to make. imo


Right now, AI‚Äôs biggest barrier isn‚Äôt capability‚Ä¶it‚Äôs friction. Complexity. Confusion.

Make AI effortless, and adoption skyrockets.

‚Ü≥ One model that knows when to reason deeply vs. answer fast

‚Ü≥ One UI that integrates search, voice, vision, and action

‚Ü≥ One system that ‚Äújust works‚Äù

Are you tracking success‚Äîor just looking at past results? 

Most businesses rely on lag indicators‚Äîmetrics that tell you what already happened.

But by the time you see a problem, it‚Äôs too late to fix it.

Benjamin faced this exact challenge‚Äîuntil he shifted his focus to lead indicators, which predict future performance and allow for proactive adjustments.

ùóüùó≤ùóÆùó± ùóúùóªùó±ùó∂ùó∞ùóÆùòÅùóºùóøùòÄ (Predictive Metrics):
 Sales Pipeline Health: Instead of just tracking closed deals, Benjamin monitored the number of high-quality leads entering the pipeline.
 Customer Engagement Rate: Instead of focusing on past revenue, he analyzed how often customers interacted with content, webinars, and trials.
 Employee Productivity Trends: Instead of waiting for quarterly performance reviews, he tracked weekly task completion rates to spot inefficiencies early.

ùóüùóÆùó¥ ùóúùóªùó±ùó∂ùó∞ùóÆùòÅùóºùóøùòÄ (Historical Metrics):
 Revenue Reports: Tells you what‚Äôs already been earned but doesn‚Äôt indicate future sales trends.
 Customer Churn Rate: Shows how many customers you lost but doesn‚Äôt help prevent attrition in real-time.
 Employee Turnover Rate: Highlights past resignations but doesn‚Äôt flag disengagement before it happens.

 The key to success? Balance both.

 Lead indicators drive proactive decisions. Lag indicators confirm if your strategy worked.

In our world‚Ä¶

It all starts with their nightly routines and rituals.

Most leaders focus on morning routines to boost performance.

But burnout doesn‚Äôt start in the morning.
It starts the night before.

If you‚Äôre constantly waking up exhausted, struggling with focus, or feeling drained by midday‚Ä¶

Your nightly habits might be working against you.

ùóõùó≤ùóøùó≤‚ÄôùòÄ ùóµùóºùòÑ ùòÅùóºùóΩ ùóπùó≤ùóÆùó±ùó≤ùóøùòÄ ùóøùó≤ùòÄùó≤ùòÅ ùóÆùóªùó± ùóøùó≤ùó∞ùóµùóÆùóøùó¥ùó≤ ùóØùó≤ùó≥ùóºùóøùó≤ ùóØùó≤ùó±:

1. Shut Down Work Mode
‚Ü≥ Your brain needs time to disconnect before it can fully recharge.
‚Ü≥ Set a ‚Äúhard stop‚Äù for emails, notifications, and work-related thoughts at least 1 hour before bed.

2. Reflect and Release
‚Ü≥ Don‚Äôt carry the stress of today into tomorrow.
‚Ü≥ Take 5 minutes to write down wins, lessons, or lingering thoughts to clear your mind.

3. Prioritize Deep Rest
‚Ü≥ Scrolling through your phone in bed? It‚Äôs stealing your energy.
‚Ü≥ Swap screens for a book, deep breathing, or calming music to signal your brain it‚Äôs time to wind down.

4. Set Up Tomorrow for Success
‚Ü≥ Decision fatigue starts before the day begins.
‚Ü≥ Lay out your priorities, schedule key tasks, and remove unnecessary decisions the night before.

5. Invest in Your Recovery
‚Ü≥ Leaders who perform at their best treat sleep as a strategy.
‚Ü≥ Stick to a consistent bedtime, optimize your sleep environment, and prioritize quality over just quantity.

The best leaders don‚Äôt just work hard.
They recover hard.

Recharge at night, lead better tomorrow.

postsData.content:
Ready to make your app available to users on the App Store?

Here's a guide for you to follow to make sure your app is up and running in no time.

üü° Step 1: App Store Categories and App Store Information

Provide relevant App Store information.

-The name and description of your app.
-The primary category your app belongs to.
-Supported languages, customer ratings, customer reviews, etc.

Choose your App Store categories wisely!

üü° Step 2: Register your Developer Account

You'll need to have a registered account.

It will have the tools you need to prepare and submit your app.

üü° Step 3: Set up Development Tools

Set up a development environment.

Install Xcode, the official Apple development tools, and other necessary software.

üü° Step 4: Write a Comprehensive Description:

Write an engaging and informative description.

It provides customers with an in-depth look at what your app does and why it should be downloaded.

üü° Step 5: Prepare Your App for Submission

Complete the technical preparations for submission.

Assemble your App Store screenshots, logo, videos, app assets, etc.

These give customers a visual impression of the app‚Äôs features, making them a crucial element.

Then complete the App Store build, including any required code and configuration.

üü° Step 6: Receive App Store Approval

The review process for the App Store review team takes anywhere between 1‚Äì2 weeks.

Once the review team approves, you'll receive a notification, and your app will be eligible for download.

üü° Step 7: Submit Apple Metadata and Link App to App Store

Submit your Apple Metadata to the App Store.

Audio and video files, PDFs, and images, along with the link to your app.

The App Store team will notify you that your app is ready to go live.

üü° Step 8: Monitor Feedback and Make Updates

Once your app has been released, customers may provide feedback through the App Store, email, or other channels.

Monitor this feedback and make necessary updates to the app.

üü° Submitting your app to the App Store

You'll need an Apple Developer account and access to a Mac computer.

First, create an iTunes Connect account to submit your app and manage its information.

Then you can use Xcode to upload your app‚Äôs binary file to the App Store.

You‚Äôll also need to provide some basic information about your app, such as its name, description, and category.

After Apple approves, it will be available for download on the App Store.

As long as you are willing to put in some hard work and dedication, there is no doubt that you will find success when attempting to launch your own iOS application.

Good luck!
postsData.commentAdded: Great guide! üéâ Excited to see new apps hitting the App Store. Best of luck to all developers on this journey! üöÄ #AppDevelopment #iOS

postsData.content:
Marketing leaders keep pushing their teams to innovate constantly.

To be first.

To be different.

To be everywhere.

But innovation without purpose drains budgets and burns out teams.

Young audiences don't want brands that chase every trend.

They want brands that stand for something real.

Constant innovation is a trap.

It makes us focus on platforms over people. On tools over genuine connections.

Marketing teams end up scattered.

Strategies get diluted.

Core messages get lost in the rush to try everything new.

Better to do a few things well than chase every shiny opportunity.

Better to build something lasting than jump on every trend.

Innovation still matters.

But it needs to actually serve your audience, not just for doing sake.

comments.commentText: I agree! Empowering team members leads to increased creativity and better results.

postsData.commentAdded: Absolutely! Purpose-driven innovation fosters deeper connections and a more cohesive brand message. Let‚Äôs focus on quality over quantity! üöÄ

Big day for goodbyes  . My last day co-hosting the Salesforce Career Show (after 3+ years) with Josh Matthews and the end of Clicked (after 2.5 years). Farewell to this chapter, but not to the incredible people.

Big Lessons:
1. Opportunities present themselves if you just show up.

I remember being in awe of Josh Matthews (still am). I had been a loyal listener of his weekly Clubhouse show back in like 2021 because it had the best advice for folks trying to break into a
career. I absolutely SQUEE-ED when he asked me to co-host. Being engaged really helped to get me connected. I've learned so much and am so grateful for the platform he extended to me. I am so incredibly proud of what we've done, the people we've supported, and the friendship (and friend group!) we've build around the show.

And with Clicked -- I thought I was going to be a pretend stakeholder like for one skills challenge... who knew I would enjoy role playing so much that I would still be doing it years later?!

2. Throw away the self limiting beliefs. Sometimes you just don't know what you're capable of yet.

Me in 2020: "I am not a content creator lol"
Me in 2025: "So I have a podcast, I write articles, I am working on an online course, I am speaking at TDX.."

I guess I just needed someone else to see it in me first ‚ÄçÔ∏è

Grateful toandfor the amazing platforms and seeing more in me than I saw in myself. Grateful for all the learners and listeners that let me be a part of their journeys. Grateful for all the friends I've made along the way (,,,to name a few).

This is maybe more of an evolution than a permanent goodbye though... I‚Äôm looking forward to collaborating with+ the newcrew and joining future episodes of the Salesforce Career Show as a guest!

postsData.content:
How Mindful CEOs Set the Tone for the Day

Mornings can either be a launching pad for success or the first battleground.

Too often, we wake up and immediately react:

Emails
Notifications
Demands of Others

Before we know it, our day is no longer ours. It belongs to a thousand competing priorities.

But what if the day was a success before the first decision hit your inbox?

This is where the AM bookend comes in.

The most effective CEOs are intentional about their mornings.

Instead of being pulled into chaos, they craft a structured start from a place of focus and clarity.

Here‚Äôs how:

1Ô∏è‚É£ Start with Stillness
 Before diving into the external world, take a few moments for yourself. Meditation, breathwork, or even a moment of silence can create spaciousness in your mind before the demands of leadership take over. Even just five minutes of deep breathing can shift your state dramatically.

2Ô∏è‚É£ Move Before You Consume
 Instead of reaching for your phone first thing, reach for movement. Stretch, walk, or engage in some form of physical activity to wake up your body and energize yourself naturally. The most effective CEOs know that peak performance isn‚Äôt just mental, it‚Äôs physical, too.

3Ô∏è‚É£ Plan With Intention
 Clarity doesn‚Äôt come from reacting; it comes from choosing where to place your energy. Before checking email, define your top priorities for the day. What‚Äôs the one thing, if completed, that would make today feel meaningful? Decide and do that first.

By implementing an AM bookend, you take ownership of your day before the world takes it from you.

What‚Äôs one small change you‚Äôve made to your morning routine that‚Äôs had the biggest impact?

 Followfor more.

postsData.content:
We‚Äôve reached peak chatbot hype. Now what?

ChatGPT, Bard, Claude‚Äîthese tools have sparked endless excitement, reshaped workflows, and even reimagined entire industries. But here‚Äôs what no one‚Äôs talking about: their limitations.

Recent research suggests we‚Äôre running up against some fundamental walls. Large Language Models, for all their brilliance, aren‚Äôt infinite wells. They struggle with reasoning, context retention, and‚Äîironically‚Äîlearning from their own mistakes.

This isn‚Äôt just about "hallucinatory" answers or quirky outputs. It's about scalability, reliability, and trust. As businesses lean harder on AI, these cracks become harder (and more expensive) for organizations like ours‚Äîbuilders, integrators, and adopters‚Äîto ignore.

So, where do we go from here?

‚Üí Realigning expectations: Chatbots weren‚Äôt meant for everything. Instead, they thrive on narrow, well-defined tasks.
‚Üí Hybrid approaches: Pair AI with human oversight. Machines scale; humans refine. Together, they deliver.
‚Üí Investing differently: Less on hype, more on infrastructure. Think robust datasets, domain-specific fine-tuning, and ethical guardrails.

We‚Äôre not at an end. We‚Äôre at an inflection point.

AI isn‚Äôt magic‚Äîit‚Äôs math. And like any tool, its value lies as much (or more) with how we use and adapt as with its design.

What‚Äôs your take? Are we ready for this next phase? Are you seeing this in your development and research?

For more, check out Quanta‚Äôs deep-dig here:

postsData.content:
9 Psychological Tricks to Look More Confident 
(than you actually feel)

You know that sinking feeling before a big meeting?
Your heart races, palms sweat, mind spirals.
That‚Äôs not a confidence problem.
It‚Äôs your brain in ‚Äúthreat mode.‚Äù

Harvard research shows stress hijacks reasoning
and amplifies self-doubt when you need confidence most.

But here‚Äôs the twist - elite performers train their brains
to stop misinterpreting stress as a threat,
and reframe stress as fuel.

Here‚Äôs how you can leverage their strategies:

1. Master controlled breathing - before your brain spirals.
‚Ü≥ The 4-7-8 method disrupts fight-or-flight mode.
‚Ü≥ Activates the vagus nerve, instantly lowering stress.

2. Reframe pressure - stress is fuel in disguise.
‚Ü≥ Top performers reframe stress as excitement ‚Äì HBR.
‚Ü≥ Your brain follows the meaning you assign it.

3. Start your day with non-negotiables.
‚Ü≥ Your morning dictates your confidence baseline.
‚Ü≥ A 15-minute ritual grounds your nervous system.

4. Use power posing - it‚Äôs science, not fluff.
‚Ü≥ Expands testosterone, shrinks cortisol in 2 minutes.
‚Ü≥ Harvard study: It boosts confidence in risk-taking.

5. Proximity shapes beliefs - confidence is contagious.
‚Ü≥ Your circle shapes your mindset ‚Äì choose growth.
‚Ü≥ Mirror neurons make mindsets highly transferable.

6. Embody ‚ÄòFuture You‚Äô - act before you feel ready.
‚Ü≥ Ask: What would the confident me do?
‚Ü≥ Action rewires your brain faster than affirmations.

7. Speak in shorter sentences - your brain loves it.
‚Ü≥ Overcomplicated speech breeds doubt
‚Ü≥ Concise speakers are perceived as more confident.

8. Stop over-praising others - it signals lower status.
‚Ü≥ Too much admiration can weaken your confidence.
‚Ü≥ Confident people acknowledge, not over-elevate.

9. Hold eye contact 1 second longer than normal.
‚Ü≥ It projects certainty and commands respect.
‚Ü≥ Breaking eye contact too soon signals insecurity.

Confidence isn‚Äôt magic - it‚Äôs a trained response.
Which one do you use? Share with me in the comments.

15 years ago, I dominated my market in real estate title insurance.

Then 2008 hit. I had a choice: wait out the tough years or start over.

I chose to start over.

Got into internet marketing, built an agency from scratch.

Different industry. Zero knowledge. Back to square one.

Over the years, I've celebrated countless wins and learned from just as many failures. Each one shaped who I am today.


So when AI emerged? It felt familiar.

I already knew what great results looked like - AI just gave me better tools to achieve them faster.


Now in 2025, AI is doing something fascinating:

- Making industry experts feel like beginners again
- Leveling the playing field for everyone
- Teaching us humility all over again
- Bringing back healthy competition


Here's how I'm paying it forward:

Support the newcomers
‚Üí Like posts from those just starting
‚Üí Share their wins, no matter how small
‚Üí Remember your own beginnings


Share what you learn
‚Üí Document your AI journey openly
‚Üí Talk about the struggles
‚Üí Help others avoid your mistakes


Stay humble
‚Üí We're all beginners again
‚Üí Today's expert is tomorrow's student
‚Üí The best insights come from beginner's mind


Here's the truth:

The biggest flex isn't (just ) being at the top.

It's knowing there's room for everyone to succeed.

The company has already deployed 4,000 GPUs and is set to activate another 2,000, despite high capital expenditures. While Yotta currently projects a net loss of $113 million for FY25, its long-term vision and aggressive expansion strategy could make it a game-changer in the global data infrastructure landscape

Grok AI: The Social-First AI Revolution You Can‚Äôt Ignore

Elon Musk‚Äôs Grok isn‚Äôt just another chatbot‚Äîit‚Äôs a game-changer for social media integration. Let‚Äôs break down why this X-integrated AI tool is turning heads (and memes).

 First Impressions

‚Ä¢ Clean Interface: Minimal design, swipe-left history, and a bottom search bar. No clutter, perfect for new users.
‚Ä¢ Missing Haptics: No tactile feedback yet (unlike ChatGPT), but updates are expected.
‚Ä¢ Web/Mobile Sync: Works seamlessly across devices.‚ÄúThe app is so simple, even your grandma could meme with it.‚Äù 

Image Generation Freedom 

‚Ä¢ Zero Copyright Filters: Create branded images (Tesla in a desert? Done ), political figures, or hyper-realistic scenes‚Äîno restrictions.
‚Ä¢ Meme Whisperer: Explains viral memes better than Gemini/Claude. ‚ÄúFinally, an AI that gets my Gen Z humor!‚Äù 

X (Twitter) Superpowers:

‚Ä¢ Profile Summaries: Instantly vet users‚Äô credibility with AI-generated bios.
‚Ä¢ Post Analysis: Tap the  icon on any tweet for context (perfect for decoding niche debates).
‚Ä¢ Direct Publishing: Share Grok‚Äôs answers as X posts in one click.

Pricing & Perks 

‚Ä¢ X Premium+ Bundle: $16/month nets you:Unlimited Grok accessAd-free X + premium featuresPriority updates.
‚Ä¢ Free Tier Limits: 10 queries/2hrs, 3 image analyses/day. ‚ÄúGreat for casual users, but heavy lifters need Premium.

Ô∏è Pros vs. Cons

 Pros:
‚Ä¢ Real-time X data integration
‚Ä¢ Uncensored creativity
‚Ä¢ Ethical creator payouts via X‚Äôs Partner Program

 Cons:
‚Ä¢ iOS-only app (for now)
‚Ä¢ Quota resets feel stingy vs. ChatGPT

 Benchmark Beast

Grok-2 dominates in:
‚Ä¢ Visual Math: 69% on MathVista (beats GPT-4o!)
‚Ä¢ Doc Understanding: 93.6% on DocVQA
‚Ä¢ Coding: Competes closely with Gemini 2.0‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not just a chatbot‚Äîit‚Äôs a STEM tutor in disguise.‚Äù 

 Should You Try It?
‚Ä¢ For X Addicts: A no-brainer‚ÄîGrok‚Äôs social integration is unmatched.
‚Ä¢ For AI Purists: Wait for Android/web expansion.
‚Ä¢ Meme Lovers: Worth the free tier alone.

Your Business Isn‚Äôt Just a Job ‚Äì It‚Äôs an Asset  
 
As a business owner, you‚Äôve put in the work, sacrificed weekends, and built something meaningful. But here‚Äôs a tough question: Can your business thrive without you?

If the answer is no, then you don‚Äôt just own a business‚Äîyou own a demanding job that depends entirely on you. And that comes at a cost:

 Lower Business Value ‚Äì Owner-dependent businesses sell for much less.
 No Personal Freedom ‚Äì You‚Äôre always on call, stuck in daily operations.
 Stunted Growth ‚Äì Without systems & leadership, scaling becomes impossible.
 Increased Risk ‚Äì A single emergency could put everything in jeopardy.

The solution? Shift from being indispensable to being scalable.

 Build a leadership team that thinks like owners.
 Document processes‚Äîmake your expertise part of the business, not just in your head.
 Develop an exit strategy‚Äîoptions give you leverage, even if you‚Äôre not leaving soon.
 Empower your team to own client relationships.

 The ultimate test? If you can step away without the business missing a beat, you‚Äôve built something truly valuable.

Start small. Pick one area, systematize it, and delegate. Your business deserves to be an asset, not just a job.

Dan Busbridge
postsData.content:
The original knowledge distillation papers left me fascinated and wondering:

"If I want a small, capable model, should I distill from a more powerful model, or train from scratch?"

With distillation becoming popular for language model training, we set out to answer this question. Our distillation scaling law shows, well, it's complicated...

In short, compared to supervised training:
1. It is only more efficient to distill if the teacher training cost does not matter.
2. Efficiency benefits vanish when enough compute/data is available.
3. Distillation cannot produce lower cross-entropies when enough compute/data is available.

We investigate this, and many other facets of distillation in detail in the paper.

This investigation answered many long-standing questions I‚Äôve had about distillation. I am deeply grateful for my amazing collaborators,,,, and, whose expertise and support brought this project to life.

postsData.content:
You're not going ANYWHERE with AI... 

Until you master this ONE skill:

Problem solving.

I just recreated a pro lighting setup, and here's what it taught me:

Every step was pure problem solving:
- See what's wrong
- Try a solution
- Adjust based on results
- Repeat

Sound familiar?

It's EXACTLY how AI works:
- Write a prompt
- See the results
- Adjust and refine your approach
- Try again

The tools don't matter. The process is identical.

I learned this recreating a living room scene:

- "Too dark" ‚Üí Kill overhead lights, add key light
- "Background's flat" ‚Üí Add depth with hallway lights and a tube light
- "Shadows look off" ‚Üí Adjust color temperature
- "Not quite there" ‚Üí Keep tweaking until it works

This is why most people fail with AI (and business for that matter):

They think better tools = better results

But whether it's lights or prompts:
You're limited by your problem solving skills.

The good news? You can practice this skill anywhere.

How do you overcome your own limitations with AI?

Follow me,for practical video creation skills that work across ALL tools.

postsData.content:
Planning Your Migration from Microsoft GP to NetSuite 

Transitioning from Microsoft GP to NetSuite? Here are five essential steps to ensure a smooth and successful migration:

 Assess Your Current System: Conduct a thorough inventory of your Dynamics GP setup, including all modules, customizations, and integrations. Perform a GAP analysis to identify differences between GP and NetSuite.
 Outline Migration Goals: Define your objectives beyond replacing an end-of-life system. Consider goals like improved reporting, streamlined processes, and enhanced scalability. Establish KPIs to measure success.
 Assemble a Cross-Functional Team: Involve stakeholders from IT, finance, operations, and other departments. Develop a communication plan to keep everyone informed about the migration timeline and progress.
 Gather Business Requirements: Plan customizations in NetSuite to match your business processes, including workflows and approval processes, ensuring NetSuite meets your specific needs.
 Develop a Training Plan: Provide comprehensive training for all users with manuals, video tutorials, and ongoing support to help them adapt to the new system.

With careful planning and the right implementation partner, your migration to NetSuite will be smooth, predictable, and successful.

postsData.content:
AI Coding: A Double-Edged Sword 

AI helps you code 70% of a project in record time‚Äîand then you hit a wall. Hard.

This is just one of the surprising truths about AI-assisted coding:

1Ô∏è‚É£ Senior engineers benefit more than beginners. This is the opposite of what we expected. AI is a multiplier, but if you lack strong fundamentals, it multiplies confusion.
2Ô∏è‚É£ AI-generated code can be a house of cards. It works‚Äîuntil it doesn‚Äôt. Production environments expose weaknesses that AI simply can‚Äôt anticipate.
3Ô∏è‚É£ Fixing one AI-generated bug often creates two more. Debugging AI-written code can feel like playing whack-a-mole.
4Ô∏è‚É£ Ironically, deep coding knowledge is required to use AI effectively. The better you understand code, the better you can steer AI‚Äîand the less likely you are to fall into its traps.

AI coding tools are powerful, but not magic. They accelerate development but don‚Äôt replace expertise. If you don‚Äôt know how to code well, AI won‚Äôt change that.
postsData.commentAdded: Great insights! Its fascinating how AI amplifies our strengths and weaknesses in coding. Mastering the fundamentals is key to leveraging this technology!

Use the 4 Ws Method:

postsData.content:
For years, I stayed behind the scenes. I focused on building, working, and delivering results, but I rarely put myself out there.

I told myself I didn‚Äôt need to. That my work should speak for itself.

But if I‚Äôm being honest, it wasn‚Äôt just about the work. I was avoiding being seen.

I was scared of being seen.

Maybe you‚Äôve felt this too.

‚Üí You want to put yourself out there, but you second-guess every post.

‚Üí You hesitate to share a photo or post a video because you don‚Äôt like how you look.

‚Üí You feel like you don‚Äôt have anything valuable to say, so you stay silent.

I kept thinking, What if no one cares?
What if I say the wrong thing?
What if I just don‚Äôt belong in this space?

So, I stayed in the background. I helped others build their brands, create content, grow their visibility, while I remained invisible.

Then one day, I realised:
‚ÄúHow can I tell people to show up if I‚Äôm not doing it myself?‚Äù

So I posted. I shared my insights, my work, my thoughts, even when it felt uncomfortable.

And you know what happened?

Nothing bad. No one called me out. No one asked me to stop.

In fact, people actually responded.

Not because I had all the answers. Not because I was perfect. But because I showed up.

So if you‚Äôve been waiting for the perfect moment, the perfect words, the perfect version of yourself: ‚Äústop waiting.‚Äù

You don‚Äôt need to be polished to be valuable.

You don‚Äôt need to be an expert to have something worth saying.

You don‚Äôt need permission to take up space.

You just need to ‚Äústart‚Äù.

Because
Someone out there is waiting for your voice, your insights, your perspective.

They don‚Äôt need you to be perfect. They just need you to be you.

The world will never know what you have to offer unless you stop hiding.

So here‚Äôs your sign: Post the thing. Share your thoughts. Take up space.

You matter. You are enough. And the world needs to hear from you.

What‚Äôs one fear that‚Äôs kept you from sharing your voice or showing up online?

80-15-5 my friends

This is a strategy that I think every innovative seller or leader has to deploy right now to stay relevant in the AI world. Things are moving too fast and every month you wait to become literate and average at this shift will impact you years from now.

80% of your time - focus on the now. Closing deals, building pipeline, running the team, etc

15% of your time - focus on projects, learning, nurturing and other activities that will impact your world in 3-9 months.

5% of your time - focus on learning and experimenting on strategies that will impact your life in 9-24 timelines. You have to get certain balls up in the air to be ready in the future.

postsData.content:
How I Never Run Out of Content Ideas for LinkedIn

Ever stared at your screen, thinking, ‚ÄúWhat should I post today?‚Äù

I‚Äôve been there. But over time, I found a system that keeps my content flowing‚Äîwithout overthinking.

Here‚Äôs how I NEVER run out of ideas:

1. Pay Attention to Conversations
‚Üí Every client call, DM, or comment is potential content.
‚Üí If someone asks a question, others are wondering the same.

2. Share Lessons from My Own Journey
‚Üí Wins, struggles, mindset shifts‚Äîpeople relate to real experiences.
‚Üí Even small insights can spark meaningful discussions.

3. Repurpose Old Content
‚Üí A post from 3 months ago? Rewrite it with a fresh angle.
‚Üí People forget, new connections haven‚Äôt seen it yet.

4. Use the ‚ÄúWhat, Why, How‚Äù Framework
‚Üí What‚Äôs a common problem in my industry?
‚Üí Why does it matter?
‚Üí How can I solve it?
‚Üí Boom! That‚Äôs a post.

5. Document, Don‚Äôt Just Create
‚Üí Behind the scenes of my business.
‚Üí What I‚Äôm working on.
‚Üí Challenges I‚Äôm tackling right now.

Content isn‚Äôt about being creative every day‚Äîit‚Äôs about knowing where to look.

Which one do you use the most? Or struggling with? Drop a comment!

 ùóúùóªùó∞ùóøùó≤ùóÆùòÄùó≤ ùó§ùòÇùó≤ùóøùòÜ ùó£ùó≤ùóøùó≥ùóºùóøùó∫ùóÆùóªùó∞ùó≤ ùòÑùó∂ùòÅùóµ ùóúùóªùó±ùó≤ùòÖùó≤ùòÄ

Indexes are crucial for speeding up query performance. They help the database find and retrieve data faster.

 ùó®ùòÄùó≤ ùóîùóΩùóΩùóøùóºùóΩùóøùó∂ùóÆùòÅùó≤ ùóóùóÆùòÅùóÆ ùóßùòÜùóΩùó≤ùòÄ
Choosing the right data type for your columns is essential for optimizing performance. Use data types that best represent the data and ensure they are as specific as possible.

 ùóîùòÉùóºùó∂ùó± ùó¶ùòÇùóØùóæùòÇùó≤ùóøùó∂ùó≤ùòÄ

Subqueries can be resource-intensive and slow down your queries. Whenever possible, use joins instead of subqueries to improve performance.

 ùó®ùòÄùó≤ ùóüùóúùó†ùóúùóß ùóºùóø ùóßùó¢ùó£ ùòÅùóº ùóüùó∂ùó∫ùó∂ùòÅ ùòÅùóµùó≤ ùó°ùòÇùó∫ùóØùó≤ùóø ùóºùó≥ ùó•ùóºùòÑùòÄ ùó•ùó≤ùòÅùòÇùóøùóªùó≤ùó±

When you only need a subset of results, use the LIMIT (MySQL) or TOP (SQL Server) clause to limit the number of rows returned.

 ùóîùòÉùóºùó∂ùó± ùó®ùòÄùó∂ùóªùó¥ ùó¶ùóòùóüùóòùóñùóß

Using SELECT * retrieves all columns, which can be unnecessary and inefficient. Instead, specify only the columns you need to reduce the amount of data retrieved.
 ùóòùó´ùóúùó¶ùóßùó¶ ùóúùóªùòÄùòÅùó≤ùóÆùó± ùóºùó≥ ùóúùó°

The EXISTS clause is generally faster than the IN clause, especially when dealing with large datasets. Use EXISTS to check for the existence of a record in a subquery.

 ùó®ùòÄùó≤ ùóöùó•ùó¢ùó®ùó£ ùóïùó¨ ùòÅùóº ùóöùóøùóºùòÇùóΩ ùóóùóÆùòÅùóÆ

The GROUP BY clause is useful for aggregating data and can help improve performance when used correctly.

 ùó®ùòÄùó≤ ùó¶ùòÅùóºùóøùó≤ùó± ùó£ùóøùóºùó∞ùó≤ùó±ùòÇùóøùó≤ùòÄ

Stored procedures are precompiled and can execute faster than individual SQL queries. They also help with code reuse and maintainability.

 ùó¢ùóΩùòÅùó∂ùó∫ùó∂ùòáùó≤ ùòÅùóµùó≤ ùóóùóÆùòÅùóÆùóØùóÆùòÄùó≤ ùóóùó≤ùòÄùó∂ùó¥ùóª

A well-designed database schema can significantly improve performance. Normalize your database to eliminate redundancy and ensure that your tables are appropriately indexed.

 ùó®ùòÄùó≤ ùó§ùòÇùó≤ùóøùòÜ ùó¢ùóΩùòÅùó∂ùó∫ùó∂ùòáùóÆùòÅùó∂ùóºùóª ùóßùóºùóºùóπùòÄ

Take advantage of query optimization tools provided by your database management system. These tools can help you identify performance bottlenecks and suggest improvements.

 ùó†ùóºùóªùó∂ùòÅùóºùóø ùó§ùòÇùó≤ùóøùòÜ ùó£ùó≤ùóøùó≥ùóºùóøùó∫ùóÆùóªùó∞ùó≤

Regularly monitor the performance of your queries to identify and address any issues. Use performance monitoring tools to track query execution times and optimize as needed.
